The interface Elevator.

Arthur Kaplan

  • Method Details

    • calculateDelay

      int calculateDelay()
      Calculates an artificial "delay time" in milliseconds that an elevator needs to reach its destination.
      Returns:
      the delay in ms

    • getElevatorNumber

      int getElevatorNumber()
      Gets the elevator number.
      Returns:
      the elevator number (a number between 1 and 7)

    • setElevatorNumber

      void setElevatorNumber(int elevatorNumber)
      Sets the elevator number.
      Parameters:
      elevatorNumber - the elevator number

    • getCurrentFloor

      int getCurrentFloor()
      Gets the current floor.
      Returns:
      the current floor

    • setCurrentFloor

      void setCurrentFloor()
      Sets the current floor.

    • getDestinationFloor

      int getDestinationFloor()
      Gets the destination floor.
      Returns:
      the destination floor of the current request

    • setDestinationFloor

      void setDestinationFloor() throws ElevatorException
      Sets the destination floor. An elevator can only travel between the ground floor and its destination without intermediate stops.
      Throws:
      ElevatorException - the elevator exception

    • getRequest

      Request getRequest()
      Gets the request.
      Returns:
      the request

    • setRequest

      void setRequest(Request request)
      Sets the request.
      Parameters:
      request - the request

    • isAvailable

      boolean isAvailable()
      The isAvailable boolean checks whether an elevator is currently free to use.
      Returns:
      true if an elevator is free to use

    • setAvailable

      void setAvailable(boolean isAvailable)
      Sets whether an elevator is available to use.
      Parameters:
      isAvailable - a boolean that checks whether the elevator is currently in use
